title: Error building Caffe2
body_html:
Issue description

I am trying to build Caffe2. I am following the official instructions on the Caffe2 page.
I am on the 0.4.0 tag of pytorch.
From the build:
cmake .. -DCPU_ONLY=ON; sudo make install

and I see the following output:

[ 26%] Built target nnpack_reference_layers [ 26%] Building CXX object third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/src/gtest-all.cc.o In file included from /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-all.cc:45:0: /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc: In static member function ‘static bool testing::internal::RE::FullMatch(const char*, const testing::internal::RE&)’: /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc:581:52: error: ‘regexec’ was not declared in this scope return regexec(&re.full_regex_, str, 1, &match, 0) == 0; ^ /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc: In static member function ‘static bool testing::internal::RE::PartialMatch(const char*, const testing::internal::RE&)’: /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc:590:55: error: ‘regexec’ was not declared in this scope return regexec(&re.partial_regex_, str, 1, &match, 0) == 0; ^ /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc: In member function ‘void testing::internal::RE::Init(const char*)’: /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc:603:63: error: ‘regcomp’ was not declared in this scope is_valid_ = regcomp(&full_regex_, full_pattern, REG_EXTENDED) == 0; ^ third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/build.make:62: recipe for target 'third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/src/gtest-all.cc.o' failed make[2]: *** [third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/src/gtest-all.cc.o] Error 1 CMakeFiles/Makefile2:621: recipe for target 'third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/all' failed make[1]: *** [third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/all] Error 2 Makefile:138: recipe for target 'all' failed make: *** [all] Error 2

Thanks for your help

System Info

Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0.176

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609
CMake version: version 3.5.1

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 9.0.176
GPU models and configuration:
GPU 0: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
GPU 1: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
GPU 2: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
GPU 3: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti

Nvidia driver version: 390.42
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.5.1.10
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.1.2
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn_static_v7.a
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.7
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.7.0.5
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn_static.a

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] numpy (1.14.3)
[pip] torch (0.4.0)
[pip] torchvision (0.2.1)
[conda] cuda90 1.0 h6433d27_0 pytorch
[conda] pytorch 0.4.0 py36_cuda9.0.176_cudnn7.1.2_1 [cuda90] pytorch
[conda] torchvision 0.2.1 py36_1 pytorch

Issue description
I am trying to build Caffe2. I am following the official instructions on the Caffe2 page.
I am on the 0.4.0 tag of pytorch.
From the build:
cmake .. -DCPU_ONLY=ON; sudo make install
and I see the following output:
[ 26%] Built target nnpack_reference_layers [ 26%] Building CXX object third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/src/gtest-all.cc.o In file included from /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-all.cc:45:0: /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc: In static member function ‘static bool testing::internal::RE::FullMatch(const char*, const testing::internal::RE&)’: /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc:581:52: error: ‘regexec’ was not declared in this scope return regexec(&re.full_regex_, str, 1, &match, 0) == 0; ^ /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc: In static member function ‘static bool testing::internal::RE::PartialMatch(const char*, const testing::internal::RE&)’: /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc:590:55: error: ‘regexec’ was not declared in this scope return regexec(&re.partial_regex_, str, 1, &match, 0) == 0; ^ /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc: In member function ‘void testing::internal::RE::Init(const char*)’: /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc:603:63: error: ‘regcomp’ was not declared in this scope is_valid_ = regcomp(&full_regex_, full_pattern, REG_EXTENDED) == 0; ^ third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/build.make:62: recipe for target 'third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/src/gtest-all.cc.o' failed make[2]: *** [third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/src/gtest-all.cc.o] Error 1 CMakeFiles/Makefile2:621: recipe for target 'third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/all' failed make[1]: *** [third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/all] Error 2 Makefile:138: recipe for target 'all' failed make: *** [all] Error 2

body:
## Issue description

I am trying to build Caffe2. I am following the official instructions on the Caffe2 page. 
I am on the 0.4.0 tag of pytorch.
From the build:
`
cmake .. -DCPU_ONLY=ON; sudo make install
`

and I see the following output:

`
[ 26%] Built target nnpack_reference_layers
[ 26%] Building CXX object third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/src/gtest-all.cc.o
In file included from /home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-all.cc:45:0:
/home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc: In static member function ‘static bool testing::internal::RE::FullMatch(const char*, const testing::internal::RE&)’:
/home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc:581:52: error: ‘regexec’ was not declared in this scope
   return regexec(&re.full_regex_, str, 1, &match, 0) == 0;
                                                    ^
/home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc: In static member function ‘static bool testing::internal::RE::PartialMatch(const char*, const testing::internal::RE&)’:
/home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc:590:55: error: ‘regexec’ was not declared in this scope
   return regexec(&re.partial_regex_, str, 1, &match, 0) == 0;
                                                       ^
/home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc: In member function ‘void testing::internal::RE::Init(const char*)’:
/home/brian/caffe2/pytorch/third_party/googletest/googletest/src/gtest-port.cc:603:63: error: ‘regcomp’ was not declared in this scope
   is_valid_ = regcomp(&full_regex_, full_pattern, REG_EXTENDED) == 0;
                                                               ^
third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/build.make:62: recipe for target 'third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/src/gtest-all.cc.o' failed
make[2]: *** [third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/src/gtest-all.cc.o] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:621: recipe for target 'third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [third_party/googletest/googletest/CMakeFiles/gtest.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:138: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2
`

Thanks for your help

## System Info
Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0.176

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609
CMake version: version 3.5.1

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 9.0.176
GPU models and configuration: 
GPU 0: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
GPU 1: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
GPU 2: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
GPU 3: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti

Nvidia driver version: 390.42
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.5.1.10
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.1.2
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn_static_v7.a
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.7
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.7.0.5
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn_static.a

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] numpy (1.14.3)
[pip] torch (0.4.0)
[pip] torchvision (0.2.1)
[conda] cuda90                    1.0                  h6433d27_0    pytorch
[conda] pytorch                   0.4.0           py36_cuda9.0.176_cudnn7.1.2_1  [cuda90]  pytorch
[conda] torchvision               0.2.1                    py36_1    pytorch
